description:
Pokémon Emerald is the definitive Gen III Pokémon game and one of the most beloved in the franchise.
Catch, train, and battle Pokémon, explore the Hoenn region, thwart the plots
of Team Magma and Team Aqua, challenge gyms, and become the Pokémon champion!

emerald/1.0.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.2

Drop `pokemon_emerald.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds/`. Drop `connector_pkmn_emerald.lua` into your Archipelago install in `/data/lua/`. To open patch files you must drag the `.apemerald` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.
emerald/1.0.0.title: Pokemon Emerald 1.0.0

emerald/1.0.1.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.2

Drop `pokemon_emerald.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds/`. Drop `connector_pkmn_emerald.lua` into your Archipelago install in `/data/lua/`. To open patch files you must drag the `.apemerald` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Changes mostly include improvements to the source code like typing, readability, and organization.

Features:
- Tracker is notified when important vanilla items are picked up (e.g. bikes when bikes aren't randomized)

Fixes:
- Fix incorrectly connected regions near desert
- Fix Ever Grande visited event below waterfall
- Greatly improve import speed
emerald/1.0.1.title: Pokemon Emerald 1.0.1

emerald/1.1.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.2

Drop `pokemon_emerald.apworld` into your Archipelago install in `/lib/worlds/`. To open patch files you must drag the `.apemerald` file onto the `ArchipelagoLauncher.exe` file.

Features:
- Starting inventory stack size increased from 99 to 999
- If the PC can fit more stacks of starting inventory after filling one slot for every item, it will
- The connector script is now internal to the apworld and will write itself to the `/data/lua` directory if it's missing/changed
- Patch files now include a version number to detect mismatched scripts/patches or vanilla ROMs

Fixes:

- Pond near Winstrates now correctly requires Surf in logic
emerald/1.1.0.title: Pokemon Emerald 1.1.0

emerald/1.2.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.2 or newer
Requires BizHawk Client

See [setup instructions](https://gist.github.com/Zunawe/406ea7a7ff50db9bf80e4bd040009fed) for detailed steps to installation and usage.

Features:

- Switch to BizHawk Client. This is much more resilient and stable, much easier for future development, and in the long run multiple games will use it and all share steps for setup and connecting. It may feel somewhat insignificant as a player, but I promise it's a big deal. The extra apworld requirement will go away after the next Archipelago release.
- Purchasing a Harbor Mail will autotrack the same way other events do. The current tracker version already supports this.

Fixes:

- Gave Igglybuff a damaging move in its vanilla starting moveset
- Walking over map triggers while continuously receiving items no longer skips those triggers
- Route 123 hidden items in the east now correctly require cut
emerald/1.2.0.title: Pokemon Emerald 1.2.0

emerald/1.2.1.description:
This version comes with Archipelago 0.4.4.

For up-to-date setup guides, see https://archipelago.gg/

Features
- New location groups
- Performance improvements

Fixes:
- Fix rare generation failure related to badge shuffle
- Fix trainers with custom moves sometimes being given empty moves
- Fix tracker events sometimes getting temporarily reset when you enter a door or open the menu
- Fix Scorched Slab not requiring Surf
- Fix Route 120 items beyond the pond to the south not requiring Surf
emerald/1.2.1.title: Pokemon Emerald 1.2.1

emerald/2.0.0-beta1.description:
Read the Changelog [here](https://github.com/Zunawe/Archipelago/blob/emerald/2.0.0-beta1/worlds/pokemon_emerald/CHANGELOG.md).

Please report bugs and unexpected behaviors.

To install, go to `Archipelago/lib/worlds/`, move your existing `pokemon_emerald.apworld` to a safe place, and then drop in the new apworld.

This is still a beta version, and is incompatible with other versions of the Emerald apworld in the same seed. Everyone who plays Emerald in a single multiworld must play on the same apworld. So keep your old apworld around in case you need to switch. Either way, the client should catch you and tell you if you try to mix and match versions.
emerald/2.0.0-beta1.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.0.0 Beta 1

emerald/2.0.0-beta2.description:
Changes since previous beta version:

- Fix non-encodable characters like `#` crashing the generator
- Renamed some trick house locations for consistency
- Added `Trick House` location group
- Removed `Postgame Locations` location group, since it has been functionally replaced by automatic exclusion of those locations
- Fix bug where blacklists for wild pokemon and opponent pokemon can be ignored when they should not be
- Make opponent movesets much, much less likely to contain duplicate moves

Read the full changelog for v2.0.0 [here](https://github.com/Zunawe/Archipelago/blob/emerald/2.0.0-beta2/worlds/pokemon_emerald/CHANGELOG.md).

Please report bugs and unexpected behaviors.

To install, go to `Archipelago/lib/worlds/`, move your existing `pokemon_emerald.apworld` to a safe place, and then drop in the new apworld.

This is still a beta version, and is incompatible with other versions of the Emerald apworld in the same seed. Everyone who plays Emerald in a single multiworld must play on the same apworld. So keep your old apworld around in case you need to switch. Either way, the client should catch you and tell you if you try to mix and match versions.
emerald/2.0.0-beta2.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.0.0 Beta 2

emerald/2.0.0-beta3.description:
Changes since previous beta version:

- Added some debug statements to wonder trading. They will be removed for the actual release. These will still pop up even when everything is working correctly, but if things go wrong, they will help me to pinpoint what your client is trying to do when it fails.
- Removed move tutor options, they are now bundled with TMs
- `tm_compatibility` renamed to `tm_tutor_compatibility`
- `tm_moves` renamed to `tm_tutor_moves`
- `reusable_tms` renamed to `reusable_tms_tutors`
- Move tutors can now have their compatibility changed
- Move tutors now say the move they teach in their dialogue
- Move tutors can be reused based on the `reusable_tms_tutors` option
- Event tickets are now controlled by the new `event_tickets` option.
- Rework `match_trainer_levels` and `match_trainer_levels_bonus`. Now you can choose between an additive or multiplicative bonus
- Species controlled by `misc_pokemon` now obey your `wild_encounter_blacklist`
- Modified a couple move/ability names in options to be more consistent with their Gen 3 spelling/format
- Victory for the champion goal now sends when you beat Wallace rather than when you register in the hall of fame
- Add a missed location in Lilycove for a man who gives you a berry
- Fix crash when randomizing opponent teams without changing TM/HM compatibility
- Fix using function non-existant in python 3.8, which caused an error during generation
- Fix deathlinks sending just before you gain control of your character in the moving truck
- Fix deathlinks sending when you soft reset
- Fix party levels not being reset to their real values after receiving a deathlink while in a battle
- Fix being able to take the ferry from Lilycove to Slateport even when you don't have the S.S. Ticket
- Fix potential softlock caused by talking to Steven on Route 118
- Fix berry trees being able to change state when they're randomized
- Possibly address rare negative exp gain when matching trainer levels. Let me know if you still encounter this.

Read the full changelog for v2.0.0 [here](https://github.com/Zunawe/Archipelago/blob/emerald/2.0.0-beta3/worlds/pokemon_emerald/CHANGELOG.md).

Please report bugs and unexpected behaviors.

To install, go to `Archipelago/lib/worlds/`, move your existing `pokemon_emerald.apworld` to a safe place, and then drop in the new apworld.

This is still a beta version, and is incompatible with other versions of the Emerald apworld in the same seed. Everyone who plays Emerald in a single multiworld must play on the same apworld. So keep your old apworld around in case you need to switch. Either way, the client should catch you and tell you if you try to mix and match versions.
emerald/2.0.0-beta3.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.0.0 Beta 3

emerald/2.0.0-beta4.description:
Changes since previous beta version:

- Fix wonder trading getting itself stuck when two clients bounce off each other due to squaring the cooldown instead of doubling it
- Fix death links sending at the start of a battle and preventing further death links from sending until the client is restarted
- Fix receiving items triggering multiple step events (repel steps, using ladders, stepping on switches, etc.)
- Fix large amounts of exp overflowing into the negatives by capping it
- The level up fanfare is now properly randomized as a fanfare instead of bgm
- The end theme (that plays during THE END on the credits) is no longer randomized (as it doesn't loop)
- Dedupe `Seafloor Cavern Room 4 - Team Aqua Grunt` into Grunt 1 and Grunt 2
- Fix allowed legendaries not being enforced in logic
- Changed fanfares to only be skippable if they are randomized
- Move man blocking Cave of Origin after Kyogre is released

Read the full changelog for v2.0.0 [here](https://github.com/Zunawe/Archipelago/blob/emerald/2.0.0-beta4/worlds/pokemon_emerald/CHANGELOG.md).

Please report bugs and unexpected behaviors.

To install, go to `Archipelago/lib/worlds/`, move your existing `pokemon_emerald.apworld` to a safe place, and then drop in the new apworld.

This is still a beta version, and is incompatible with other versions of the Emerald apworld in the same seed. Everyone who plays Emerald in a single multiworld must play on the same apworld. So keep your old apworld around in case you need to switch. Either way, the client should catch you and tell you if you try to mix and match versions.
emerald/2.0.0-beta4.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.0.0 Beta 4

emerald/2.0.1.description:
This version comes with Archipelago 0.4.6.

Fixes:
- Renamed Ho-oh to Ho-Oh
- Temporary fix to prevent missing items when connecting to an in-progress slot using `remote_items`
- Fixed Dewford Town water encounters not logically requiring Surf
- Disable one of Kyogre's potential spawn locations (it will be re-enabled in the future when a fix is in place)
emerald/2.0.1.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.0.1

emerald/2.1.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.5.

This is the same as v2.0.0 with the additional migration to `APProcedurePatch`, meaning:
- you don't need to have a copy of Pokemon Emerald in order to generate and
- patch files are created much faster

Seeds generated with this apworld are compatible with 2.0.0 apworlds and vice versa as long as the players are running Archipelago 0.4.5.
emerald/2.1.0.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.1.0

emerald/2.1.1.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.4.5 or newer.

This is the same as v2.0.1 with the additional migration to APProcedurePatch, meaning:

- you don't need to have a copy of Pokemon Emerald in order to generate and
- patch files are created much faster

Seeds generated with this apworld are compatible with 2.0.1 apworlds and vice versa.
emerald/2.1.1.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.1.1

emerald/2.2.0.description:
Requires Archipelago 0.5.0 or newer. This version comes with Archipelago 0.5.0.

[Changelog](https://github.com/Zunawe/Archipelago/blob/emerald/2.2.0/worlds/pokemon_emerald/CHANGELOG.md)
emerald/2.2.0.title: Pokemon Emerald 2.2.0
